Description: Fritware (stonepaste) dish decorated with palmettes, hare and foliate motifs; made of black slipware and glazed pottery (white).
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qum, OA register: "Said to have come from Qum".
Curator's comments: Fritware dish painted in black with a hare and foliate motifs under a transparent glaze Iran, 12th century
Bibliographic references: Lane 1947 / Early Islamic Pottery: Mesopotamia, Egypt and Persia (fig.48)
Pinder-Wilson 1976b / Oriental Ceramics, the world's great collections: the British Museum (fig.290)
Oriental Ceramic Society 1950 / Early Islamic Wares: Catalogue of an Exhibition Held by the Oriental Ceramic Society from April 26th to June 7th 1950 (46)
Pinder-Wilson 1958b / A Recent Gift of Islamic Pottery (p.86)
